{{also|Strasse}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Strasse}} {{qualifier|Switzerland and Liechtenstein}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|strāze}} (also as {{m|gmh|strōze}}, {{m|gmh|strouze}}), from {{inh|de|goh|strāza}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*strātō|t=street}}, an early borrowing from {{der|de|LL.|strāta}}. Cognate to {{cog|nl|straat}}, {{cog|en|street}}, {{cog|it|strada}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃtraːsə/}} * {{audio|de|De-Straße.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Straße.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|aːsə}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Straßen|Sträßchen}} # [[street]]; [[road]] {{gloss|a way wide enough to be passable for vehicles, generally paved, in or outside a settlement}} #: {{ux|de|Das Kind überquerte die '''Straße'''.|The child crossed the '''street'''.}} #: {{ux|de|Diese '''Straße''' führt nach Kirchdorf.|This '''road''' goes to Kirchdorf.}} #: {{ux|de|Die '''Straße''' ist für den Verkehr gesperrt.|The '''street''' is closed for traffic.}} # [[carriageway]] {{gloss|the part of a road or street used by vehicles, excluding the pavement, etc.}} # {{q|figuratively}} [[public]], any area accessible to anyone # {{q|figuratively}} [[general public]], using the locale to describe people not part of a specific group # the [[streets]], areas or groups of people of no income or criminal affiliation, or the leading of a life associated with these # [[strait]] {{gloss|channel of water}} # {{lb|de|poker}} [[straight]] ====Usage notes==== * Ways too narrow for vehicles to pass are usually called {{m|de|Weg}}, if between houses also {{m|de|Gasse}}. In old cities, narrow paths may still be called {{m|de||Straße}}, particularly if the word is part of the names of these streets. * The prepositional use is different from, and in some cases the opposite of, that in English. In most or all contexts, {{m|de|auf}} is possible. It is the only common preposition when referring specifically to the space between the houses (pavement and carriageway): {{m|de||Die Kinder spielen auf der Straße.|t=The children are playing in the street.}} When a street is used as a geographical location, however, {{m|de|in}} is more common: {{m|de||Das Auto steht in der Straße an der Kirche.|t=The car is parked in the street by the church.}} {{m|de||Der Laden ist in der Weberstraße.|t=The shop is on Weber street.}} In the latter example, which refers to a house, {{m|de|an}} is possible as a third alternative. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Str.}} {{q|abbreviation}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |Hauptstraße |Anwohnerstraße |Bundesstraße |Landstraße |Nebenstraße |Seidenstraße |Seitenstraße |Wasserstraße |Privatstraße |Wohnstraße |Straßenbahn |Straßenkreuzung |Straßenschild |Straßenverkehr }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Roads]]
